com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IWorkspaceManager

All Superinterfaces:
IEventSource
public interface IWorkspaceManager
extends IEventSource

Methods for managing workspaces and streams. The workspace manager is closely tied to its ITeamRepository, and and only really works when the client is logged in to the repository.

Team repository objects are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on ITeamRepository and its various subsidiaries, including IWorkspaceManager, can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Since:
0.5

teamRepository

ITeamRepository teamRepository()
Returns the repository associated with this manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Returns:
the repository, which is never null

versionableManager

IVersionableManager versionableManager()
Returns an object for retrieving individual versionables from this workspace manager. The client need not be logged in to this repository.

Returns:
the versionable manager, which is never null

knownWorkspaceConnections

java.util.List knownWorkspaceConnections()
Returns the collection of the workspace connections known to the repository. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Note that this operation does not contact the server. There is at most one workspace connection per workspace per team repository (per client). Logging out of this team repository automatically disables much the workspace connections; however, the repository continues to remember the list of known workspace connections even while logged out.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection of all workspace connections known to the repository (element type: IWorkspaceConnection); unmodifiable and fixed; the elements are all distinct workspaces and are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null

knownBaselineConnections

java.util.List knownBaselineConnections()
Returns the collection of the baseline connections known to the repository. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Note that this operation does not contact the server. There is at most one baseline connection per baseline per team repository (per client). Logging out of this team repository automatically disables much of these connections; however, the repository continues to remember the list of known connections even while logged out.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection of all baseline connections known to the repository (element type: IBaselineConnection); unmodifiable and fixed; the elements are all distinct baseline and are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null

knownComponents

java.util.List knownComponents()
Returns the collection of the components known to the repository. The client need not be logged in to the repository.

Note that this operation does not contact the server.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection of all components known to the repository (element type: IComponentHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the elements are all distinct workspaces and are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null

getWorkspaceConnection

IWorkspaceConnection getWorkspaceConnection(IWorkspaceHandle workspaceHandle,
                                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                            throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the workspace connection used for long-term interactions with the given workspace.

There is at most one connection per workspace per team repository (per client). Each IWorkspaceManager maintains an internal list of workspace connections. Logging out of this team repository automatically disables much functionality for known workspace connections; however, the repository continues to remember the list of known workspace connections even while logged out.

Parameters:
workspaceHandle - the workspace auditable item; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the workspace connection; never null
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the specified workspaceHandle was not found (typically, if the workspace has been deleted)
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
IFlowNodeConnection.getResolvedWorkspace()

getWorkspaceConnections

java.util.List getWorkspaceConnections(java.util.List workspaces,
                                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns a list of workspace connections used for long-term interactions with the given workspaces.

There is at most one connection per workspace per team repository (per client). Each IWorkspaceManager maintains an internal list of workspace connections. Logging out of this team repository automatically disables many of its workspace connections; however, the repository continues to remember the list of known workspace connections even while logged out.

Parameters:
workspaces - the list of workspace items; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of workspace connections ordered in the same way that the input list is ordered; an entry will be null if the corresponding workspace was not found on the server; never null
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

copyWorkspace

IWorkspaceConnection copyWorkspace(IAuditableHandle scopeHandle,
                                   IWorkspaceConnection peerWorkspaceConnection,
                                   java.lang.String workspaceName,
                                   java.lang.String description,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Creates the workspace by cloning another workspace. Returns a workspace connection. The new workspace has no long-term relationship to the original. The new workspace is scoped to the given contributor or team, if the source is a stream then the scope must be a team area otherwise if it's a workspace then the scope must be a contributor.

The flow table of the new workspace is initially a copy of that of the other workspace. The initial components and their associated change histories, bases and configurations are normally the same as the current configuration of the given workspace, including conflicts and active change sets. For repository workspaces, they will be private to the creator.

Parameters:
scopeHandle - the owning scope; must not be null
peerWorkspaceConnection - the connection to the peer workspace; must not be null
workspaceName - the workspace name; must not be null or an empty string
description - the workspace description; may be null
progressMonitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a connection to the new workspace; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
PermissionDeniedException - if the logged-in user doesn't have permission to create repository workspaces or streams in the given team area
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

createWorkspace

IWorkspaceConnection createWorkspace(IContributorHandle scopeHandle,
                                     java.lang.String workspaceName,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
Creates an empty workspace in the repository. The new workspace is scoped to the given contributor. The initial change history and configuration of the workspace is empty. The workspace will be private to the creator.

Parameters:
scopeHandle - the owning contributor; must not be null
workspaceName - the workspace name; must not be null or an empty string
description - the workspace description; may be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a connection to the new workspace; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
PropertyConstraintException - if the supplied properties violate a constraint of the item being updated
PermissionDeniedException - if the logged-in user doesn't have permission to create repository workspaces; see IScmProcessConfiguration#REPOSITORY_ROLE_REPOWORKSPACE
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

createWorkspace

IWorkspaceConnection createWorkspace(IContributorHandle scopeHandle,
                                     java.lang.String workspaceName,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     IWorkspaceConnection defaultFlow,
                                     IWorkspaceConnection sourceWorkspace,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
Creates a workspace in the repository. The new workspace is scoped to the given auditable, and has flow relationships with the specified workspaces. The initial change history and configuration of the workspace is the same as that from the source workspace. The workspace will be private to the creator.

Parameters:
scopeHandle - the owning scope; must not be null
workspaceName - the workspace name; must not be null or an empty string
description - the workspace description; may be null
defaultFlow - the workspace for which we shall set as the default bidirectional flows; may be null to indicate that no flows should be set up.
sourceWorkspace - the workspace containing the change history to be used to prime the new workspace; can be null
syncInfo - the synchronization info that the caller wishes to synchronize on, or null if the caller doesn't care about synchronization
progressMonitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
an connection to the new workspace; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
PropertyConstraintException - if the supplied properties violate a constraint of the item being updated
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
Since:
0.7

createWorkspace

IWorkspaceConnection createWorkspace(IContributorHandle scopeHandle,
                                     java.lang.String workspaceName,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     IBaselineSetHandle sourceBaselineSet,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
Creates a workspace in the repository. The new workspace is scoped to the given auditable, and has flow relationships with the specified workspaces. The initial change history and configuration of the workspace is the same as that from the source workspace. The workspace will be private to the creator.

Parameters:
scopeHandle - the owning scope; must not be null
workspaceName - the workspace name; must not be null or an empty string
description - the workspace description; may be null
sourceBaselineSet - the baseline set to create the workspace from, cannot be null
syncInfo - the synchronization info that the caller wishes to synchronize on, or null if the caller doesn't care about synchronization
progressMonitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
an connection to the new workspace; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
PropertyConstraintException - if the supplied properties violate a constraint of the item being updated
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
Since:
0.7

findWorkspacesByName

IItemQueryPage findWorkspacesByName(java.lang.String namePattern,
                                    boolean matchWorkspaces,
                                    boolean matchStreams,
                                    boolean matchOwners,
                                    int pageSize,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor progressMonitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Deprecated. use IWorkspaceManager.findWorkspaces(IWorkspaceSearchCriteria, int, IProgressMonitor)

Finds all workspaces in the repository that match the given criteria. Either matchWorkspaces or matchStreams must be true (or both). Returns the first page of results. Use IWorkspaceManager.fetchNextPage(IItemQueryPage, IProgressMonitor) to fetch subsequent pages.

Parameters:
namePattern - a pattern to be matched against the name of the workspace IWorkspace.getName() in the item's current state. The matching is case-insensitive. The pattern may contain two special characters '%' and '_'. All '%' characters match 0 or more patterns in the name and all '_' characters match exactly one character in the name. All other characters in the pattern must match the name exactly. Must not be null
matchWorkspaces - true to match items with isStream()==false, false to ignore them
matchStreams - true to match items with isStream()==true, false to ignore them
matchOwners - true to match against the owner name in addition to the workspace name, false to only match the workspace name
pageSize - the maximum number of results to return in the requested page.
progressMonitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the first page of the result; never null; the page may be empty if no matches were found
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
Since:
0.7

setComponentOwnerAndVisibility

void setComponentOwnerAndVisibility(IComponentHandle comp,
                                    IAuditableHandle newOwner,
                                    IReadScope newScope,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor progress)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Set the owner and visibility of the given component.

Parameters:
comp - The component to modify. May not be null.
newOwner - The new owner for the component. Must be an IProjectAreaHandle, an ITeamAreaHandle or IContributorHandle.

If the caller wishes to keep the current owner, and only set the scope, they may pass IScmService.NOOP_OWNER into the method.

newScope - The new visibility for the component. See IReadScope or https://jazz.net/wiki/bin/view/Main/SCMReadAccess2 for a listing of valid scope/owner pairings.

If the caller passes IScmService.DEFAULT_VISIBILITY into this method, then an appropriate, reasonably secure scope will be chosen for the given owner. Callers should not expect any particular scope to be chosen.

progress - A progress monitor. May be null.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the supplied component does not exist in the repository
PropertyConstraintException - if the supplied properties violate a constraint of the item being updated
PermissionDeniedException - if the logged-in user doesn't have permission to change the owner is this component.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

Parameters:
component - the component for which to search for baselines; matched against the component of the baseline IBaseline.getComponent()in the item's current state; must not be null
commentPattern - a string to be matched as a prefix of the comment of the baseline IBaseline.getComment()in the item's current state; for instance, "Foo" matches both "Foobar" and "Foozball"; retrieve all baselines by using the empty string which matches any name; must not be null
progressMonitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a collection of baselines (element type: IBaselineHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the baselines are in unspecified order which may vary from call to call; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
Since:
0.7

createLinks

com.ibm.team.scm.common.internal.dto.CreateLinksResult createLinks(java.lang.String linkTypeId,
                                                                   IWorkspaceHandle workspace,
                                                                   IChangeSetHandle changeSet,
                                                                   java.util.List resourceUris,
                                                                   java.util.List comments,
                                                                   java.util.List extraInfos,
                                                                   java.util.List contentTypes,
                                                                   boolean doBacklink,
                                                                   boolean force,
                                                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
OSLC EXPERIMENTAL - DO NOT USE Creates a link from a change set to a set of OSLC resource URI links. An event for this creation will be sent via the ILinkEvent.LINK_SAVED_EVENT_TYPE event. Note. Caller is responsible for providing the correct linkTypeId and arguments valid for that type of link. Misusing linkTypeId can have severe consequences. Clients MUST handle only linkTypeId's that they explicitly know about. Note. If a link matches the given link type id, change set and change request URI then it is ignored (not updated). Note. comments, extraInfos, contentTypes must either be null or have the same size as changeRequests.

Parameters:
linkTypeId - type of link, see ILink.getLinkTypeId()
workspace - workspace that contains the change set being linked (optional, can be null
changeSet - the change set being linked; never null
resourceUris - the target uri's being linked to; never null
comments - comments associated with each link target (can be null or contain null entries)
extraInfo - extra info associated with each link target (can be null or contain null entries)
contentType - content type associated with each link target (can be null or contain null entries)
doBacklink - create oslc backlink (assume resourceUri is appropriate oslc resource uri and linkTypeId has a corresponding oslc backlink)
force - create link even if backlink fails. Ignored if doBacklink is false.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the links that were created
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
See Also:
IReferenceFactory.createReferenceFromURI(URI, String, String, String)

applyLockOperations

void applyLockOperations(java.util.Collection lockOperations,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
Applies the versionable lock operations atomically in the repository. Clients are expected to build up their collections of versionables to lock in particular streams, and to call this method with the total desired set of locks to grab in the repository.

Parameters:
lockOperations - a list of non-null IWorkspaceManager.IVersionableLockOperation elements; duplicates/equivalent elements tolerated.
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Throws:
ItemNotFoundException - if the stream does not exist in the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the component is not present in the stream
InvalidWorkspaceOperationException - if a specified stream is actually a workspace and not a stream
ItemLockedInStreamException - if the item cannot be locked because it has already been locked elsewhere
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
LockOperationFailureException - if the locks operations could not be performed
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason.
Since:
0.7

removeSuspended

void removeSuspended(java.util.Collection changeSets,
                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
Removes change sets from this contributor's suspended set.

Use #suspend(Collection) to add change sets to the suspended set.

The operation has the following preconditions:

  • The client must be logged in to the repository.
  • The specified change sets are in the workspace's suspended set.
The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

If the change sets are active, then they are closed prior to being removed from the suspended set.

Parameters:
changeSets - the list of change sets to remove (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
Since:
0.7

transferChangeSetsFromRemoteRepository

java.util.List transferChangeSetsFromRemoteRepository(java.util.List remoteChangesToTransfer,
                                                      ITeamRepository remoteRepository,
                                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
Replicates closed change sets from a remote repository into the current repository. Duplicates active change sets from a remote repository into the suspended set of the logged in contributor.

Parameters:
remoteChangesToTransfer - - the change sets to transfer, cannot be null or contain null elements
remoteRepository - - the remote repository to transfer from, must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a list of change sets which aligns one-to-one with the change sets provided.
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException

getConsolidatedChanges

com.ibm.team.scm.common.dto.IConsolidatedChangesReport getConsolidatedChanges(IChangeSetHandle[] changeSets,
                                                                              com.ibm.team.scm.common.dto.IPagedFetchDescriptor pageDescriptor,
                                                                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                              throws TeamRepositoryException
Given a list of change sets return a consolidated description of the changes for each item. For each item, it includes information about the estimated initial and final states of the combined changes, change sets and states involved, creating dates and authors. Caller will be able to display this information and perform actions such as opening appropriate compare editors, opening states or corresponding change sets. Paging is done per component, to get the next set of results pass IConsolidatedChangesComponentReport.getNextPageDescriptor() along with the change sets corresponding to that component (see IConsolidatedChangesComponentReport.getChangeSetIds()

Parameters:
changeSets - the change sets
pageDescriptor - (optional) a descriptor of what page to fetch. Pass IConsolidatedChangesComponentReport.getNextPageDescriptor() from a previous invocation. If not null, then changeSets must all be from the same component.
monitor - a progress monitor
Returns:
a description of the consolidated changes, separated by component
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException
Since:
0.9.1

calculateParentPaths

com.ibm.team.scm.common.dto.IConsolidatedChangeSetsPathReport calculateParentPaths(IContextHandle context,
                                                                                   IChangeSetHandle[] changeSets,
                                                                                   UUID[] parentIds,
                                                                                   IVersionableHandle[] changedParentItems,
                                                                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Given a list of change sets from a single component, parents of changed items, and parents that they themselves have changed in the list of change sets, return a description of the paths of the parent folder items that are included in the change set report.

Parameters:
context - the context to use, may be null. Currently only workspaces are supported
changeSets - the change sets (must be all from the same component)
parentIds - the parents of the changed items
changedParentItems - parents that have been changed in the list of change sets
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress and cancellation is not required
Returns:
a path report that defines the paths of the provided parents of the changed items
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException
Since:
0.9.1
